channel.title: Can't boot Fedora?
channel.description:
Whenever I boot I get this error
"The media check is complete, the result is fail!" then it says something and then it says dropped to shell.. What do I do?
EDIT: This is a LiveCD

item.title: Can't boot Fedora?
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

eczema3:

Redownload the image file, it could be that that is corrupt, I had a corrupt ISO once for ubuntu, it kept freezing on me, re-installed it with a new iso fo the same version it worked fine.

Yes and make sure to check the MD5 sum I remember when I was using ubuntu I had an option to verify the written data or something also. But I assume your still on windows.

Read full topic

item.title: Can't boot Fedora?
item.dc:creator: @bjc22 bjc22
item.description:
@bjc22 wrote:

Or you can try using a different burning software. Some burning software always mess up the disks. (from past experiences)

Read full topic

item.title: Can't boot Fedora?
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

Redownload the image file, it could be that that is corrupt, I had a corrupt ISO once for ubuntu, it kept freezing on me, re-installed it with a new iso fo the same version it worked fine.

item.title: Can't boot Fedora?
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Lil Goon, post:9, topic:287257”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=379847.msg2856971#msg2856971 date=1246929244]

[quote author=la­wl link=topic=379847.msg2856926#msg2856926 date=1246926859]

[quote author=Lil Goon link=topic=379847.msg2856085#msg2856085 date=1246862548]

Sounds like the livecd wasn’t burned correctly, as in something is corrupt.
[/quote]Hmm, I’ll re burn it… Also, its a dvd I didn’t have any more CD’s could that be the problem?

Could be, depending on if you burned it right or not, try it again and see what happens.
[/quote]Reburned it, still didn’t work. I’ll go out and buy some CD’s tomorrow.

why buy cds, it doesnt make a difference

Unless you’re an poor fucker who can’t afford a decent line/CD burner.
[/quote]Not poor… My CD burner has always burned fine…[/quote]
That wasn’t directed at anyone.

Read full topic
